net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552

Class ConflictChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552.ModelChecker
      • net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552.ConflictChecker

  • public class ConflictChecker
extends ModelChecker

    A dummy implementation of a conflict checker.

    The run() method of this model checker does nothing, and simply claims that every model is nonconflicting.

    You are welcome to edit this file as much as you like, but please do not change the public interface. Do not change the signature of the two constructors, or of the run() or getCounterExample() methods. You should expect a single constructor call, followed by several calls to run() and getCounterExample(), so your code needs to be reentrant.

    WARNING: If you do not comply with these rules, the automatic tester may fail to run your program, resulting in 0 marks for your assignment.

    Author:
    Robi Malik
    See Also:
    ModelChecker

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConflictChecker

        public ConflictChecker(ProductDESProxy model,
                       ProductDESProxyFactory desFactory)
        Creates a new conflict checker to check whether the given model nonconflicting with respect to the default marking proposition.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be checked by this conflict checker.
        desFactory - Factory used for trace construction.

      • ConflictChecker

        public ConflictChecker(ProductDESProxy model,
                       EventProxy marking,
                       ProductDESProxyFactory desFactory)
        Creates a new conflict checker to check a particular model.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be checked by this conflict checker.
        marking - The proposition event that defines which states are marked. Every state has a list of propositions attached to it; the conflict checker considers only those states as marked that are labelled by marking, i.e., their list of propositions must contain this event (exactly the same object).
        desFactory - Factory used for trace construction.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public boolean run()
        Runs this conflict checker. This method starts the model checking process on the model given as parameter to the constructor of this object. On termination, if the result is false, a counterexample can be queried using the getCounterExample() method. Presently, this is a dummy implementation that does nothing but always returns true.
        Specified by:
        run in class ModelChecker
        Returns:
        true if the model is nonconflicting, or false if it is not.

      • getCounterExample

        public ConflictCounterExampleProxy getCounterExample()
        Gets a counterexample if the model was found to be conflicting, representing a conflict error trace. A conflict error trace is a sequence of events that takes the model to a state that is not coreachable. That is, after executing the counterexample, the automata are in a state from where it is no longer possible to reach a state where all automata are marked at the same time.
        Specified by:
        getCounterExample in class ModelChecker
        Returns:
        A conflict trace object representing the counterexample. The returned trace is constructed for the input product DES of this conflict checker and shares its automata and event objects.
